macros.token: pca

param.name: factorName
param.label: Specify a factor name, e.g. effects_drug_x or cancer_markers
param.help: Only letters, numbers and underscores will be retained in this field

param.name: factorLevel
param.label: Specify a factor level, typical values could be 'tumor', 'normal', 'treated' or 'control'
param.help: Only letters, numbers and underscores will be retained in this field

param.name: stat_test
param.label: Select statistical to apply
param.help: Please enter at max 1 statistical test by file
param.option: distribution fitting (of the z-score of the ratios), disfit needs several hundreds of metabolites to be trustful.

param.name: metadata_path
param.label: metadata file
param.help: The metadata, a unique file with the description of the samples in your measures' files. This is compulsory, see section Metadata File Information.

param.name: abundance_file
param.label: Metabolite abundance file
param.help: The total abundances file must be organized as a matrix: - The first column must contain Metabolite IDs that are unique (not repeated) within the file. - The rest of the columns correspond to the samples - The rows correspond to the metabolites - The values must be tab separated, with the first row containing the sample/column labels. (see help below for more details)

param.name: me_or_frac_contrib_file
param.label: Metabolite enrichment file
param.help: The mean enrichment file must be organized as a matrix: - The first column must contain Metabolite IDs that are unique (not repeated) within the file. - The rest of the columns correspond to the samples. - The rows correspond to the metabolites. - The values must be tab separated, with the first row containing the sample/column labels. (see help below for more details)

param.name: isotop_prop_file
param.label: Isotopologues proportion abundance file
param.help: The isotopologue proportions file must be organized as a matrix: - The first column must contain isotopologues IDs that are unique (not repeated) within the file. - The rest of the columns correspond to the samples. - The rows correspond to the isotopologues. - The values must be tab separated, with the first row containing the sample/column labels (see help below for more details).

param.name: isotop_abs_file
param.label: Isotopologues absolute abundance file
param.help: The isotopologue absolute values file must be organized as a matrix: - The first column must contain isotopologues IDs that are unique (not repeated) within the file. - The rest of the columns correspond to the samples. - The rows correspond to the isotopologues. - The values must be tab separated, with the first row containing the sample/column labels (see help below for more details).

param.name: me_or_frac_contrib_file
param.label: Mean enrichment or fraction contribution file

param.name: data_input_selector
param.label: Abundance, Enrichment or Isotopologues count files
param.help: Select between raw abundance, mean enrichment or isotopologue files

param.name: metabolites_list
param.label: Select Metabolite(s) for factor 1 to plot (2 Max.). You have to load a abundance file prior to have access to metabolite list

param.name: metabolites_list
param.label: Select Metabolite(s) for factor 1 to plot (2 Max.). You have to load a abundance file prior to have access to metabolite list

param.name: path_kegg_metabolites
param.label: Pathways kegg metabolites file
param.help: A file with the pathways and respective metabolites ID, that must match with those in your metabolomics data. The names of the columns must be the pathways' names, see the minimal data example downloaded from zenodo as explained above. (see help below for more details)

param.name: path_kegg_transcripts
param.label: Pathways kegg transcripts file
param.help: A file with the pathways and respective gene symbols, which must match with those present in the transcriptomics data. The names of the columns must be the pathways' names, see the minimal data example downloaded from zenodo as explained above. (see help below for more details)

param.name: data_input_selector
param.label: Abundance, Enrichment or Isotopologues count files
param.help: Select between raw abundance and mean enrichment files

param.name: suffix
param.label: suffix to add to output files

param.name: conditions
param.label: Browse conditions from metadata file (1 min. only if two timepoints are set. 2 max.). You have to load a metadata file prior to have access to metabolite list

param.name: conditions
param.label: Browse conditions from metadata file. (1 min. only if three timepoints are set). You have to load a metadata file prior to have access to conditions

param.name: timepoint
param.label: Browse timepoint from metadata file (1 min. only if three conditions are set). You have to load a metadata file prior to have access to conditions

param.name: timepoint
param.label: Browse timepoint from metadata file (1 min. only if two conditions are set.)

param.name: grouping
param.label: Browse group to compare

param.name: correction_method
param.label: Select multiple test correction to apply

param.name: compartments
